definitions.definition: used when you are leaving somebody or when somebody else is leaving

examples.text: Goodbye! It was great to meet you.
She didn't even **say goodbye** to her mother.
Say goodbye to Mary for me.
Take out our service contract and say goodbye to costly repair bills.

definitions.definition: to accept that you will lose something or be unable to do something

examples.text: Well, you can kiss goodbye to your chances of promotion.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent.: contraction of God be with you!, with good substituted on the pattern of phrases such as good morning.
